page.title: 03CROCKETT VIEW
page.content: The newest housing area consists of houses built by the council and let to tenants.It has the name of Crockett View, a name chosen to commemorate a famous writer Samuel Rutherford Crockett, born at Little Duchrae farm just outside the village of Laurieston in the parish of Balmaghie.There is also a stone monument, on a small hill in a prominent part of the village, to his memory.S.R Crockett was born in 1860 and died in 1914.He is considered to be one of Galloway's most distinguished literary figures and became firmly established as a romantic novelist.Among his many books are "The Raiders" and "Men of Moss Hags", both of which have local settings and themes and did much to put Galloway on the English literary map.The local inhabitants are proud of their famous "son".
